member.name: T:FakeItEasy.Core.IFakeCallProcessorProvider
member.summary: The responsibility of this interface is to instantiate a new and to fully initialize it (e.g. applying the initial configuration). This should happen one time on the first call of or .

remarks.para: Note that the implementation of this interface must be thread-safe and guarantee the one-time-initialization property when accessing the interface methods concurrently (could happen when using this provider in spawned threads in a proxy base constructor).

An implementation of this interface should also be serializable and the deserialized object should behave like the original one *after* it has been initialized (i.e. after the first call of or ) because we don't need to serialize a fake before it has been initialized (returned to the user).

member.param: The corresponding proxy object of the new .

member.name: M:FakeItEasy.Creation.IFakeOptions.ConfigureFake(System.Action{System.Object})
member.summary: Specifies an action that should be run over the fake object for the initial configuration (during the creation of the fake proxy).
member.param: An action to perform on the Fake.

remarks.para: Note that this method might be called when the fake is not yet fully constructed, so should use the fake instance to set up behavior, but not rely on the instance's state. Also, if FakeItEasy has to try multiple constructors in order to create the fake (for example, because one or more constructors throw exceptions and must be bypassed), the action will be called more than once, so it should be side effect-free.

member.notes: This method evaluates an expression, but tries to do it in a light-weight way that doesn't compile it into a delegate. It is often used to solve 'what object/value does the user-supplied Expression refer to?'
member.param: The expression to be evaluated.
member.returns: The value returned from the delegate compiled from the expression.

member.name: T:FakeItEasy.IBootstrapper
member.summary: Bootstrapper for FakeItEasy.

remarks.para: When FakeItEasy is initialized, it scans the executing app domain for implementations of this interface. If any are found, one will be instantiated and used to bootstrap FakeItEasy. If no implementations are found, then a will be used.

member.summary: Gets the default Priority used by client-supplied s, s, and s.
member.remarks: Equivalent to a Priority with value 0.

member.name: P:FakeItEasy.Priority.Internal
member.summary: Gets the Priority used by all FakeItEasy-supplied s, s, and s.

remarks.para: Equivalent to a Priority with value -1.

We have a single such Priority because it's all that's currently needed, and we're unlikely to introduce built-in dummy factories, fake options builders, or argument value formatters that would collide with one another. Just in case, though, all negative values have been reserved for use by FakeItEasy.

member.name: M:FakeItEasy.Priority.CompareTo(FakeItEasy.Priority)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.returns:
A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings:
less than zero: this instance precedes in the sort order
zero: this instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as
greater than zero: this instance follows in the sort order
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.

member.name: T:FakeItEasy.Repeated
member.summary: Provides syntax for specifying the number of times a call must have been repeated when asserting on fake object calls.

member.name: P:FakeItEasy.Repeated.Never
member.summary: Asserts that a call has not happened at all.

member.name: P:FakeItEasy.Repeated.Exactly
member.summary: The call must have happened exactly the number of times that is specified in the next step.

member.name: P:FakeItEasy.Repeated.AtLeast
member.summary: The call must have happened any number of times greater than or equal to the number of times that is specified in the next step.

member.name: P:FakeItEasy.Repeated.NoMoreThan
member.summary: The call must have happened any number of times less than or equal to the number of times that is specified in the next step.

member.name: M:FakeItEasy.Repeated.Like(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Int32,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Specifies that a call must have been repeated a number of times that is validated by the specified repeatValidation argument.
member.param: A predicate that specifies the number of times a call must have been made.

member.name: M:FakeItEasy.Repeated.Matches(System.Int32)
member.summary: When implemented gets a value indicating if the repeat is matched by the Happened-instance.
member.param: The repeat of a call.
member.returns: True if the repeat is a match.
